Check out the documentation for our in-house commenting system!

## Overview

This documentation site provides comprehensive guides, usage instructions, and reference materials for our in-house commenting system. It is designed to help developers understand how to integrate, configure, and utilise the features offered effectively.

Browse the sections using the navigation on the left for a deeper dive into each app in the monorepo.
This document refers to the Comments API located in `/apps/api`

The Comments API is a RESTful service built with Express and Prisma, providing endpoints for managing articles, comments, users, moderation actions, and statistics. It is secured with API key authentication and supports CORS for local development.

- **Location:** `/apps/api`
- **Tech Stack:** Express, Prisma, Zod, TypeScript
- **Authentication:** API Key via `x-api-key` header
- **CORS:** Enabled for `http://localhost:5173` (TODO: Insert actual endpoints)

---

## Middleware

- **JSON Body Parser:** Parses incoming JSON requests.
- **CORS:** Allows requests from local dev origins.
- **API Key Auth:** Requires `x-api-key` matching `process.env.API_KEY`. Returns `401` if missing or invalid.

---

## Internal Packages

- [Shared Types](/packages/shared-types): Common types for API and frontend
- [TypeScript Config](/packages/typescript-config): Shared TypeScript configuration

---

## Endpoints

### `/comments`

- `GET /comments`  
  List all comments, optionally filtered by article, status, or user.

- `POST /comments`  
  Create a new comment. Requires comment body, article ID, and user info.

- `PATCH /comments/:id`  
  Update a comment's content or status.

---

### `/users`

- `GET /users`  
  List all users.

- `GET /users/:id`  
  Get details for a specific user.

---

### `/articles`

- `GET /articles`  
  List articles. Supports query params:

    - `searchTerm`: Filter by article title or author.
    - `status`: Filter by commenting status (`OPEN`, `CLOSED`).
    - `page`: Pagination.

- `PATCH /articles/:id`  
  Update article status (e.g., open/close commenting).

---

### `/status-changes`

- `GET /status-changes`  
  List all status change events for articles or comments.

---

### `/statistics`

- `GET /statistics`  
  Get platform statistics (e.g., comment counts, user activity).

---

## Error Handling

- Returns `401` for missing/invalid API key.
- Returns `400` for validation errors (Zod).
- Returns `500` for server errors.

---

```http
GET /articles?searchTerm=example&status=OPEN&page=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:80
x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY
```

The Comments API is a RESTful service built with Express and Prisma, providing endpoints for managing articles, comments, users, moderation actions, and statistics. It is secured with API key authentication and supports CORS for local development.

  • Location: /apps/api
  • Tech Stack: Express, Prisma, Zod, TypeScript
  • Authentication: API Key via x-api-key header
  • CORS: Enabled for http://localhost:5173 (TODO: Insert actual endpoints)

Middleware

Section titled Middleware
  • JSON Body Parser: Parses incoming JSON requests.
  • CORS: Allows requests from local dev origins.
  • API Key Auth: Requires x-api-key matching process.env.API_KEY. Returns 401 if missing or invalid.

Internal Packages

Section titled Internal Packages
  • Shared Types: Common types for API and frontend
  • TypeScript Config: Shared TypeScript configuration

Endpoints

Section titled Endpoints

/comments

Section titled /comments

  • GET /comments
    List all comments, optionally filtered by article, status, or user.

  • POST /comments
    Create a new comment. Requires comment body, article ID, and user info.

  • PATCH /comments/:id
    Update a comments content or status.

/users

Section titled /users

  • GET /users
    List all users.

  • GET /users/:id
    Get details for a specific user.

/articles

Section titled /articles

  • GET /articles
    List articles. Supports query params:

    • searchTerm: Filter by article title or author.
    • status: Filter by commenting status (OPEN, CLOSED).
    • page: Pagination.

  • PATCH /articles/:id
    Update article status (e.g., open/close commenting).

/status-changes

Section titled /status-changes
  • GET /status-changes
    List all status change events for articles or comments.

/statistics

Section titled /statistics
  • GET /statistics
    Get platform statistics (e.g., comment counts, user activity).

Error Handling

Section titled Error Handling
  • Returns 401 for missing/invalid API key.
  • Returns 400 for validation errors (Zod).
  • Returns 500 for server errors.

The Infrastructure app manages deployment, configuration, and cloud resources for the Comments platform using Pulumi and TypeScript.

- **Tech Stack:** Pulumi, TypeScript

- **Internal Packages:** Uses `@repo/shared-types` and utility modules from `/packages`

## Architecture Overview

```mermaid
graph TD
  A[Infrastructure App]
  B[Pulumi Stack]
  C[comments.ts]
  E[AWS Lambda]
  F[AWS API Gateway]
  G[AWS S3]

  A --> B
  B --> C
  C --> E
  C --> F
  C --> G

```

---

## Tooling

- **Pulumi:** Infrastructure as Code for provisioning AWS resources
- **TypeScript:** Strong typing and code sharing with app and package code.
- **Utilities:** Custom helpers in `/apps/infrastructure/utils` for resource definitions and type safety.

- `index.ts`: Main entry for Pulumi stack definitions.

- `utils/`: Shared utility functions and types.

---

- **`typescript-config`**: Shared TypeScript configuration for consistent builds.

import * as aws from '@pulumi/aws'

Reference documentation for the Web frontend in `/apps/web`

The Web project contains the Comments moderation dashboard which is built with React, Vite, and TypeScript. It provides the means for staff to interact with articles, comments, users, and statistics. It connects to the [Comments API](/apps/api)

- **Location:** `/apps/web`
- **Tech Stack:** React, Vite, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS

---

## Routes & Structure

- `src/routes/`: Route modules for pages (e.g., articles, comments, auth).
- `src/services/`: API client logic for communicating with the Comments API.
- `src/utils/`: Shared frontend utilities.
- `src/index.tsx`: App entry point.
- `vite.config.ts`: Vite configuration.

### Route Overview

All routes prefixed with `/auth` require the user to be logged in, or they will be redirected to the login screen, as defined in `routes/_auth.tsx`

- `/auth/`  Landing page & dashboard showing relavent statistics for the moderators
- `/auth/articles`  List and search articles
- `/auth/moderate`  Main area for reviewing and moderation of comments in real time
- `/auth/users`  View and manage users
- `/auth/settings`  Not yet implemented: Will provide the ability to customise settings and preferences for each app
- `/auth/history`  Overview of changes to comment statuses

---

## Further Reading

- [React Documentation](https://react.dev/)
- [Vite Documentation](https://vitejs.dev/)
- [Tailwind CSS Documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs)
